history.content:
This is correct. The GPA will only include the second attempt (unless you've already repeated 12 hours of courses). Before you purposefully fail the course, I would suggest talking to your TA or Professor to see if the grade can be salvaged. Failing grades will be considered if you decide to apply to graduate school, for example. For your reference, the official policy is here: 

You may repeat a course only if you received a grade of D+, D, D-, F, or NP.

If you earned a grade of D+, D, D-, or F, and have taken the course only once:

  • you must take the course for a letter grade
  • both grades will show on your transcript, but only your most recent grade will be calculated into your GPA

Note: If you have repeated more than 12 units of credit, this does not apply.

I want to retake a class (CS course). Can I fail the class to retake it? Other than appearing on the transcript as F, is there anything else gonna happen? My understanding is: I fail a course, retake it and get a good grade (in A range), GPA would be only including the latter one. Is this true for technical courses too?
history.subject: Retake process
